memberdef.argsstring: (void *MsgPtr, CFE_SB_MsgId_t MsgId, uint16 Length, boolean Clear)
memberdef.name: CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Initialize a buffer for a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine fills in the header information needed to create a valid software bus message.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that will contain the message. This will point to the first byte of the message header. The void* data type allows the calling routine to use any data type when declaring its message buffer.
The message ID to put in the message header.
The total number of bytes of message data, including the SB message header .

A flag indicating whether to clear the rest of the message:
TRUE - fill sequence count and packet data with zeroes.
FALSE - leave sequence count and packet data unchanged.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode

briefdescription.para: Get the size of a software bus message header.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine returns the number of bytes in a software bus message header. This can be used for sizing buffers that need to store SB messages. SB message header formats can be different for each deployment of the cFE. So, applications should use this function and avoid hard coding their buffer sizes.

listitem.para: For statically defined messages, a function call will not work. The macros CFE_SB_CMD_HDR_SIZE and CFE_SB_TLM_HDR_SIZE are available for use in static message buffer sizing or structure definitions.

parameterdescription.para: The message ID to calculate header size for. The size of the message header may depend on the MsgId in some implementations. For example, if SB messages are implemented as CCSDS packets, the size of the header is different for command vs. telemetry packets.

entry.para: The number of bytes in the software bus message header for messages with the given MsgId. endstmt

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum

briefdescription.para: Get a pointer to the user data portion of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine returns a pointer to the user data portion of a software bus message. SB message header formats can be different for each deployment of the cFE. So, applications should use this function and avoid hard coding offsets into their SB message buffers.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message.

entry.para: A pointer to the first byte of user data within the software bus message.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize

briefdescription.para: Get the message ID of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine returns the message ID from a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message.

entry.para: The software bus Message ID from the message header.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize

briefdescription.para: Sets the message ID of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets the Message ID in a software bus message header.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.
The message ID to put into the message header.

entry.para: The software bus Message ID from the message header.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode, CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Gets the length of user data in a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine returns the size of the user data in a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

entry.para: The size (in bytes) of the user data in the software bus message.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize

briefdescription.para: Sets the length of user data in a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets the field in the SB message header that determines the size of the user data in a software bus message. SB message header formats can be different for each deployment of the cFE. So, applications should use this function rather than trying to poke a length value directly into their SB message buffers.

listitem.para: You must set a valid message ID in the SB message header before calling this function.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.
The length to set (size of the user data, in bytes).

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode, CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Gets the total length of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine returns the total size of the software bus message.

listitem.para: For the CCSDS implementation of this API, the size is derived from the message header.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

entry.para: The total size (in bytes) of the software bus message, including headers.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize

briefdescription.para: Sets the total length of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets the field in the SB message header that determines the total length of the message. SB message header formats can be different for each deployment of the cFE. So, applications should use this function rather than trying to poke a length value directly into their SB message buffers.

simplesect.title: Assumptions, External Events, and Notes:
simplesect.para: None

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.
The length to set (total size of the message, in bytes, including headers).

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode, CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Gets the time field from a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine gets the time from a software bus message.

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a time field, then this routine will return a zero time.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

entry.para: The system time included in the software bus message header (if present), otherwise, returns a time value of zero.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize

briefdescription.para: Sets the time field in a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets the time of a software bus message. Most applications will want to use CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg instead of this function. But, when needed, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime can be used to send a group of SB messages with identical time stamps.

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a time field, then this routine will do nothing to the message contents and will return CFE_SB_WRONG_MSG_TYPE.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.
The time to include in the message. This will usually be a time returned by the function CFE_TIME_GetTime().

entry.para: This error code will be returned when a request such as ...SetMsgTime is made on a packet that does not include a field for msg time.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode, CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Sets the time field in a software bus message with the current spacecraft time.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets the time of a software bus message with the current spacecraft time. This will be the same time that is returned by the function CFE_TIME_GetTime.

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a time field, then this routine will do nothing.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode, CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Gets the command code field from a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine gets the command code from a software bus message (if SB messages are implemented as CCSDS packets, this will be the function code).

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a command code field, then this routine will return a zero.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

entry.para: The command code included in the software bus message header (if present). Otherwise, returns a command code value of zero.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_SetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize

briefdescription.para: Sets the command code field in a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine sets the command code of a software bus message (if SB messages are implemented as CCSDS packets, this will be the function code).

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a command code field, then this routine will do nothing to the message contents and will return CFE_SB_WRONG_MSG_TYPE.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.
The command code to include in the message.

entry.para: This error code will be returned when a request such as ...SetMsgTime is made on a packet that does not include a field for msg time.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_SetMsgId, CFE_SB_SetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_SetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_SetMsgTime, CFE_SB_TimeStampMsg, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_InitMsg

briefdescription.para: Gets the checksum field from a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine gets the checksum (or other message integrity check value) from a software bus message. The contents and location of this field will depend on the underlying implementation of software bus messages. It may be a checksum, a CRC, or some other algorithm. Users should not call this function as part of a message integrity check (call CFE_SB_ValidateChecksum instead).

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a checksum field, then this routine will return a zero.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

entry.para: The checksum included in the software bus message header (if present), otherwise, returns a checksum value of zero.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GetUserData, CFE_SB_GetMsgId, CFE_SB_GetUserDataLength, CFE_SB_GetTotalMsgLength, CFE_SB_GetMsgTime, CFE_SB_GetCmdCode, CFE_SB_GetChecksum, CFE_SB_MsgHdrSize, CFE_SB_ValidateChecksum, CFE_SB_GenerateChecksum

briefdescription.para: Calculates and sets the checksum of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine calculates the checksum of a software bus message according to an implementation-defined algorithm. Then, it sets the checksum field in the message with the calculated value. The contents and location of this field will depend on the underlying implementation of software bus messages. It may be a checksum, a CRC, or some other algorithm.

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a checksum field, then this routine will do nothing.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_ValidateChecksum, CFE_SB_GetChecksum

briefdescription.para: Validates the checksum of a software bus message.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: This routine calculates the expected checksum of a software bus message according to an implementation-defined algorithm. Then, it checks the calculated value against the value in the message's checksum. If the checksums do not match, this routine will generate an event message reporting the error.

listitem.para: If the underlying implementation of software bus messages does not include a checksum field, then this routine will always return TRUE.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the buffer that contains the software bus message. This must point to the first byte of the message header.

entry.para: The checksum field in the packet is valid.
The checksum field in the packet is not valid or the message type is wrong.

simplesect.para: CFE_SB_GenerateChecksum, CFE_SB_GetChecksum

memberdef.argsstring: (char *DestStringPtr, const char *SourceStringPtr, const char *DefaultString, uint32 DestMaxSize, uint32 SourceMaxSize)
memberdef.name: CFE_SB_MessageStringGet

memberdef.argsstring: (char *DestStringPtr, const char *SourceStringPtr, uint32 DestMaxSize, uint32 SourceMaxSize)
memberdef.name: CFE_SB_MessageStringSet
